LanguageData.PlantMangrove.label: mangrove
LanguageData.PlantMangrove.description: Mangroves are trees or shrubs that grow in salty water in hot places like the tropics。
LanguageData.PlantTreePalm.label: coconut tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeDrago.label: drago tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeDrago.description: A hardy desert tree topped with thick, pointed leaves。
LanguageData.PlantTreeOak.label: oak tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeOak.description: Oak trees are slow growing, strong, hardwood trees。
LanguageData.PlantTreePoplar.label: poplar tree
LanguageData.PlantTreePoplar.description: Poplar trees are quick growing, softwood trees. They produce less wood than oak trees。
LanguageData.PlantTreePine.label: pine tree
LanguageData.PlantTreePine.description: Pine trees are large conifer, softwood trees。
LanguageData.PlantTreeBirch.label: birch tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeBirch.description: Birch trees are northern, white trees known for having a thin, paper-like bark。
LanguageData.PlantTreeTeak.label: teak tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeTeak.description: Teak trees are very strong and slow growing hardwood trees. Wood from Teak Trees was used in ancient times to build sailing ships。
LanguageData.PlantTreeCecropia.label: cecropia tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeCecropia.description: Cecropia trees are small, common rainforest trees. It grows very fast, but yields little usable wood。
LanguageData.PlantTreeWillow.label: willow tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeWillow.description: One of the fastest growing shade trees providing a beautiful, thick, leafy canopy. Doesn't yield much usable wood。
LanguageData.PlantTreeCypress.label: cypress tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeCypress.description: A tall, slow-growing tree. Typically found in swamps. Despite its slow growth, planting these trees can be profitable because they yield much usable wood。
LanguageData.PlantTreeMaple.label: maple tree
LanguageData.PlantTreeMaple.description: A common, medium-sized tree. It's often found in swamps and on moist terrain。
LanguageData.PlantTreeRedwood.label: redwood
LanguageData.PlantTreeRedwood.description: A huge, very slow growing tree. Its roots are shallow, and when it gets too large, it topples over. \n\n Yields red wood, which is valuable and rare。
